edges.label: has diagnosis
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with Ascites from Portal Hypertension.
edges.facts_and_info: Ascites is an accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity. The patient's condition is likely due to portal hypertension, as indicated by imaging showing nodular liver and splenomegaly.

edges.label: has diagnosis
edges.detailed_description: The patient has been diagnosed with Non-compliance with medications.
edges.facts_and_info: Non-compliance with prescribed diuretics and low-sodium diet contributed to worsening symptoms. The patient discontinued Furosemide and Spironolactone on her own.

edges.label: related to
edges.detailed_description: The non-compliance with medications is a contributing factor to the development of Ascites from Portal Hypertension.
edges.facts_and_info: Non-adherence to prescribed diuretics and low-sodium diet has led to worsening ascites. The patient's condition improved after resuming medications.
